justification: “All data were collected … with a 30-item instrument developed specifically for assessing a base discounting level and then the five anomalies.”
The paper states that the 30-item instrument was “developed specifically for assessing a base discounting level and then the five anomalies,” one of which it lists as “Absolute magnitude.”
Among the five anomalies the authors set out to measure with their 30-item instrument they include “Gain-loss asymmetry,” indicating this construct is assessed with that same set of choice items.
The Measurement section explains that the instrument tests the anomaly “Delay-speedup asymmetry” along with the other four, confirming the measure used.
Present bias is named as one of the five anomalies incorporated into the 30-item intertemporal-choice instrument (“we also assess subadditivity … Present bias …”).
The authors add a fifth anomaly, subadditivity, and note that it too is assessed within the same 30-item instrument developed for the study.
